Component: Helpers

Introduction

A collection of simple helper classes to be used when building our UIs.

Helpers list

To learn more about the hide-on-* classes, check out the Layout page.

Class Description
.is-invisible Used to visibly hide elements from view, but retain the space it takes up in the document.
.is-visible Used to show elements that were previously hidden using .is-invisible.
.hide-on-mobile Used to hide elements when the viewport is mobile in size.
.hide-on-middle Used to hide elements when the viewport is larger than mobile, but smaller than desktop in size.
.hide-on-desk Used to hide elements when the viewport is desktop in size.
.hide-on-large Used to hide elements when the viewport is larger than desktop.

Background Colors

To use color to separate sections on a website, consider using one of the four following classes:

Class Description Color
.tsla-scrim--white White #ffffff / $white
.tsla-scrim--light Light #fafafa / $grey-background-color-lightest
.tsla-scrim--dark Dark #eeeeee / $grey-e
.tsla-scrim--black Black #000000 / $black


Sample of scrims below:

This is a white scrim.

This is a light scrim.

This is a dark scrim.

This is a black scrim.
▲ 
<section class="tsla-scrim--white">
  <div class="styleguide-demo">This is a white scrim.</div>
</section>

<br>

<section class="tsla-scrim--light">
  <div class="styleguide-demo">This is a light scrim.</div>
</section>

<br>

<section class="tsla-scrim--dark">
  <div class="styleguide-demo">This is a dark scrim.</div>
</section>

<br>

<section class="tsla-scrim--black">
  <div class="styleguide-demo">This is a black scrim.</div>
</section>
